results.name: Sequence matrix for odd numbers.
comment: Diagonal sums yield sum{k=0..floor(n/2),2(n-2k)+1}=C(n+2,2)=A000217(n+1). Note that sum{k=0..n,2(n-2k)+1}=n+1.
Call this array M and for k = 0,1,2,... define M(k) to be the lower unit triangular block array
having the k x k identity matrix I_k as the upper left block; in particular, M(0) = M. The infinite matrix product M(0)*M(1)*M(2)*..., which is clearly well-defined, is equal to A208904. (End)
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n=0..150 of triangle, flattened
formula: a(n)=2*A004736(n)-1; a(n)=2*((t*t+3*t+4)/2-n)-1, where t=floor((-1+sqrt(8*n-7))/2). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Feb 08 2013
